projects.name: Hexagonal Gift Boxes

steps.instruction: Cut two 12x12 inch squares from patterned paper and two 12x12 inch squares from cardstock.
steps.visual_description: Four squares of paper.

steps.instruction: Score fold lines on each square as shown in the diagram.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a square with diagonal lines from each corner to the center, and horizontal lines dividing the square into thirds.

steps.instruction: Cut along the indicated lines on the patterned paper squares.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a square with cut lines from the midpoints of each side to the center.

steps.instruction: Fold and assemble the boxes.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing how to fold the flaps to create the box shape.

steps.instruction: Cut ribbon to desired length and tie a bow around each box.
steps.visual_description: Ribbon being tied around a finished box.

tips: Use a bone folder for crisp folds.
Experiment with different paper patterns and colors.

projects.name: Pop-Up Flower Card

materials.color: pink, orange, yellow, purple, green, blue

projects.finished_product_description: A pop-up card with a bouquet of paper flowers and leaves inside. A light blue gift tag with a pink ribbon is attached to the front of the card.

diagram_descriptions: A pop-up card with a bouquet of paper flowers and leaves inside. The flowers are in various shades of pink, orange, yellow, and purple. Green paper leaves and blue paper stems are also visible. A light blue gift tag with a pink ribbon is attached to the front of the card, lying on top of the white card base. In the background, a glass cup holds three colored pencils: blue, yellow, and green. The background is a light gray surface with some colored paper scraps (orange, red, green, yellow) scattered around.

projects.name: Pop-up bouquet
projects.finished_product_description: A cheerful and personal pop-up card suitable for various occasions.

diagram_descriptions: A flat lay of materials and tools for making a pop-up bouquet card. The materials include a stack of colored cardstock in rainbow order (teal, grey, purple, blue, green, yellow, orange, red), a white card folded in half, tracing paper, and a roll of double-sided tape. The tools include scissors, a scorer, a pencil, and a ruler. A cutting mat is visible underneath the cardstock. The text 'You will need' is highlighted in a pink tag.

projects.name: Paper Flowers

steps.instruction: Trace all the pieces of the template and position them image side down on the coloured card. Rub over the pattern with a pencil to transfer the image onto the card.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a red pencil tracing a flower template onto orange paper. Several smaller, pre-cut flower shapes in different colors (pink, yellow, purple) are visible on the table.

steps.instruction: Carefully score along any dotted lines and cut out any solid lines with scissors or a scalpel. Repeat this until you’ve cut and scored all the pieces of the template.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a scalpel and a ruler scoring a dotted line on an orange paper flower shape. The ruler has inch markings.

steps.instruction: The four central flowers that need to be assembled are made in pairs. Fold along the score marks and overlap the first and seventh petals to make a cone shape, using tape to secure. Fold in half as shown on the orange flower.
steps.visual_description: A hand folding the petals of a pink paper flower. Another hand is holding a yellow paper flower, showing how the petals are folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Stick double-sided tape to two petals and attach a different coloured flower, leaving one petal unattached at either end. You should end up with a shape that is four petals wide and only attached at the middle two petals.
steps.visual_description: A hand attaching a yellow paper flower petal to an orange paper flower petal using double-sided tape. The text box indicates that two sets of these flowers are needed.

tips: You will need two sets of these flowers.
projects.finished_product_description: Paper flowers made by folding and adhering petals.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1 shows a hand tracing a flower template onto colored paper with a pencil.
Diagram 2 shows a hand using a scalpel and ruler to score a dotted line on a paper flower shape.
Diagram 3 shows hands folding the petals of paper flowers.
Diagram 4 shows a hand attaching paper flower petals together with double-sided tape.

projects.name: Pop-Up Bouquet

steps.instruction: Fold the small pink central flower that is scored in three places and stick one side on the card at the angle pictured above. Peel the backing off the tape on the top edge and fold the card in half so the other half sticks in the right position.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown folding a small pink flower with tape on one side, preparing to stick it to a card. The card is partially open.

steps.instruction: Using the double-sided tape or a little glue, stick a dot in the middle of the central flower so it sits on either side of the fold. Then stick coloured dots in the middle of all the remaining flowers.
steps.visual_description: Several colorful paper flowers are laid out on a light-colored wooden surface. A hand is placing a small orange dot in the center of a red flower. The text indicates that scored flowers also need dots.

steps.instruction: Fold and position one side of the green leaf as shown. It's crucial that the point of the crease is in the gutter and the top edge is 4cm (1½in) from the gutter. Apply tape to the top and close the card so the other side sticks in the correct spot.
steps.visual_description: A hand is holding a green paper leaf with a crease. A ruler is placed against the card, showing the top edge of the leaf is 4cm (1½in) from the gutter. The leaf is positioned on an open card.

steps.instruction: Stick the two flowers that have nine petals in position on either side of the central folded flower. Then stick the two large flowers that have six petals to the top edge of the green leaf – one on either side.
steps.visual_description: A pop-up bouquet is being assembled inside a card. A hand is placing a pink flower with a light pink center onto the structure. Other flowers, including a purple one and a red one, are already in place.

tips: The scored flowers need dots as well.
projects.finished_product_description: A pop-up bouquet card with multiple colorful flowers.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 5 shows a hand applying tape to a folded pink paper flower, preparing to attach it to a card.
Diagram 6 shows various colorful paper flowers and small dots on a wooden surface, with a hand placing a dot on a flower.
Diagram 7 shows a hand holding a green paper leaf with a crease, a ruler measuring 4cm (1½in) from the gutter on a card, indicating placement.
Diagram 8 shows a hand adding a pink flower to a partially assembled pop-up bouquet inside a card, with other flowers already attached.

projects.name: Pop-Up Flower Card

steps.instruction: Add a small blade of grass to the back of two of the central flowers that you assembled in steps 3 and 4. Stick the grass on this petal.
steps.visual_description: Close-up photo showing a green paper blade of grass being adhered to the back of a pink paper flower petal, which is part of a larger orange and pink layered flower assembly. The petal is heart-shaped.

steps.instruction: Position the central flowers into the crease in the middle as shown. There should only be tape on the bottom petal.
steps.visual_description: Photo showing a hand positioning an assembled paper flower bouquet (consisting of pink, orange, yellow, and purple flowers with green leaves) into the central crease of a white card base. Tape is visible on the bottom petal of one of the central orange flowers.

steps.instruction: Stick the other half of the flower to the other side of the card, but this time add tape to just the top petal. Stick on the remaining central flowers in the same way. This will ensure the flower pops out properly.
steps.visual_description: Photo showing a hand pressing down the other half of the paper flower assembly onto the opposite side of the card's crease. The flower assembly includes pink, orange, and green elements. A text box points to the action, stating 'This will ensure the flower pops out properly.'

steps.instruction: Stick the two medium-sized flowers with score lines on either side of the fold. Then add the little red flower above them, and the little pink one below.
steps.visual_description: Photo showing a hand sticking a yellow medium-sized paper flower with a pink center onto the card, next to the main flower assembly. Other small red and pink flowers are also visible on the white card background, ready to be placed.

tips: Add tape to just the top petal when sticking the other half of the flower to the card to ensure the flower pops out properly.

diagram_descriptions: Header with text 'CARDS AND GIFT WRAP' and a small red square icon with a white star.

projects.name: Pop-Up Flower Bouquet Card

steps.instruction: If you have any sticky pads, you can use them here, instead of tape, to add depth.
steps.visual_description: A blue paper strip with a small white square (sticky pad) attached, with a dotted line indicating placement.

steps.instruction: If you like, add a gift tag to the inside of the card.
steps.visual_description: Text box with instruction about adding a gift tag inside the card.

steps.instruction: Finally, stick down the edge of the bouquet using double-sided tape. Line them up so the crease near the bottom lines up with card's gutter.
steps.visual_description: Hands are shown adhering a blue strip of paper to the edge of a pop-up flower bouquet inside a card. The blue strip is positioned along the crease of the card.

tips: If you have any sticky pads, you can use them here, instead of tape, to add depth.
projects.finished_product_description: A pop-up card featuring a colorful bouquet of flowers.

diagram_descriptions: Close-up of a hand adhering a blue strip to the edge of a pop-up flower bouquet inside a card. The blue strip is aligned with the card's crease.
A blue paper strip with a small white square (sticky pad) attached, with a dotted line indicating placement.
A pop-up flower bouquet with vibrant pink, orange, yellow, and purple flowers and green leaves, partially visible inside a card.
Decorative floral elements with flowers in pink, purple, and yellow, and green leaves, at the bottom right corner of the page, with the number '19' on one of the flowers.

projects.name: Paper Feather Embellishment

steps.instruction: Trace the templates and lay them face down on card. Rub to transfer.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a green pencil, tracing the outline of multiple feather shapes onto a translucent paper or tracing paper, which is laid over a light-colored card or surface. Several feather outlines are already visible.

steps.instruction: Cut around the edge of your feather.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding small silver scissors, carefully cutting along the traced outline of a blue paper feather. Small, irregular scraps of blue paper are scattered on the wooden surface around the feather.

steps.instruction: Score along the middle of the feather then pinch to bend along the scored line.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a scoring tool with a brass tip, pressing down to create a score line along the central axis of the cut-out blue paper feather. The feather rests on a grey textured surface.

steps.instruction: Cut slices toward the middle to create a feathery effect. Tie ribbon around the bottom and attach to gifts.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding small silver scissors, making short, angled cuts from the edges of the blue paper feather towards its scored center line, creating a textured, feathery appearance. The feather is now fully shaped and textured.

projects.finished_product_description: A decorative paper feather with a scored central line and textured edges, designed to be attached to cards or gifts with a ribbon.

projects.name: Envelope

steps.instruction: On the back of the paper, draw along the two diagonals to mark the centre.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a ruler and pencil, drawing a diagonal line on a piece of paper. The paper is placed on a blue wooden surface. A ruler with inch markings is visible.

steps.instruction: Fold two opposite corners into the centre, then fold and unfold a third corner.
steps.visual_description: A hand folding two opposite corners of a patterned paper towards the center. The paper has a pattern of colorful circles. The background is a blue wooden surface.

steps.instruction: Turn the paper and fold the last corner so it lines up with the pencil and fold line.
steps.visual_description: A hand folding the last corner of the patterned paper. The fold is aligned with a previously drawn pencil line. The background is a blue wooden surface.

steps.instruction: Unfold the previous fold and align the point with the new fold line as shown.
steps.visual_description: A hand unfolding a section of the patterned paper. A dotted line indicates a new fold line, and a point is being aligned with it. The background is a blue wooden surface.

projects.finished_product_description: A partially folded envelope made from patterned paper.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: Shows a hand using a ruler and pencil to draw diagonal lines on the back of a piece of paper to mark the center.

Diagram 4: Shows a hand unfolding a fold and aligning a point with a new fold line, indicated by a dotted line.

projects.name: DIY Envelopes

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom corners so the edges run along the horizontal fold lines.
steps.visual_description: Hands folding the bottom corners of a patterned paper square inwards, aligning the edges with horizontal fold lines.

steps.instruction: Pull out the point at the bottom and push the diagonal folds underneath to create a tongue.
steps.visual_description: Hands pulling out the bottom point of the paper and tucking the diagonal folds underneath to form a flap or tongue.

steps.instruction: Fold the tongue over and tuck into the middle.
steps.visual_description: Hands folding the created tongue over the center of the paper structure.

steps.instruction: Place your note inside and seal with a sticker, tape, glue, or wax.
steps.visual_description: A completed patterned paper envelope with a note placed inside, ready to be sealed.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed DIY envelope made from patterned paper.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 5: Folding bottom corners inward.
Diagram showing step 6: Creating the envelope tongue.
Diagram showing step 7: Folding the tongue.

projects.name: Origami Gift Box

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half twice to make a square, then open back out.
steps.visual_description: Hands folding a square piece of patterned paper in half, then in half again, and then unfolding it. A bone folder is used to crease the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold diagonally, then open out and fold along the other diagonal.
steps.visual_description: Hands folding a square piece of patterned paper diagonally, then unfolding and folding along the other diagonal. The paper is now creased with two diagonal lines forming an 'X'.

steps.instruction: Open out and fold all of the corners into the centre.
steps.visual_description: Hands folding the four corners of a square piece of patterned paper to meet at the center point, creating a smaller square shape.

steps.instruction: Fold two of the edges inward so they meet in the middle. Unfold and repeat with the other sides.
steps.visual_description: Hands folding two opposite edges of the paper inward to meet at the center line. The paper is then unfolded, showing creases along these lines. This step is to be repeated for the other two sides.

steps.instruction: Unfold two of the central tabs.
steps.visual_description: Hands unfolding two of the triangular flaps that were folded into the center in step 3. These tabs are now standing up.

projects.finished_product_description: A partially formed origami box with some flaps folded inwards and others standing up.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A square piece of paper being folded in half twice and then unfolded, showing creases.

Diagram 4: A square piece of paper with two opposite edges folded to meet in the center, and then unfolded. The instruction indicates to repeat for the other sides.
Diagram 5: A square piece of paper with two central tabs unfolded, standing upwards.

projects.name: Mini Gift Box

steps.instruction: Turn the box and lift up the sides.
steps.visual_description: Hands holding a partially folded paper structure, lifting up the sides to form the box shape.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides in as shown, then fold the top point into the centre of the box.
steps.visual_description: Hands folding the sides of the paper structure inwards and then folding the top point towards the center.

steps.instruction: Turn the box on its side and push into all of the corners to secure.
steps.visual_description: A hand pushing the corners of the box inwards to secure the structure.

steps.instruction: Repeat on the other side, then make the other half of the box. Use slightly smaller paper for the other half of the box.
steps.visual_description: A completed half of a gift box, showing its open top and folded sides. The text indicates to repeat the process for the other half, using slightly smaller paper.

tips: Use slightly smaller paper for the other half of the box.

projects.name: Scored Paper Box

steps.instruction: Trace the template and lay it face down on your paper. Rub to transfer.

steps.instruction: Cut around the edges then carefully score along the lines.
steps.visual_description: Hands using a ruler and craft knife to cut along the edge of the blue-grey paper. Dashed lines are visible on the paper, indicating scoring lines.

steps.instruction: Use a bone folder to neatly fold along the scored lines.
steps.visual_description: Hands using a white bone folder to crease the scored lines on the blue-grey paper, which is beginning to take the shape of a box.

steps.instruction: Make a hole in the four sides using one corner of a hole punch.
steps.visual_description: A clear corner hole punch is being used to make a hole in one of the flaps of the blue-grey paper box.

tips: Use screw punch for clean holes

steps.instruction: Thread a strand of ribbon through the holes to finish.

materials.color: various (e.g., white, yellow, purple, pink, tan)

tools.name: craft knife
tools.purpose: cutting out intricate paper designs and ovals

steps.instruction: Repeat with the other templates, then trace and cut out the oval.

projects.name: Paper Cutting Art

steps.instruction: Using a pencil, transfer the template to tracing paper and turn it over. Lay it on top of your card and rub over the tracing with pencil to transfer the image onto the card.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a pencil over a piece of tracing paper with a design on it, which is placed on top of another piece of paper.

steps.instruction: Using a fresh blade, carefully start cutting the smaller, fiddly areas of the picture such as the eyes, arms, and the inside of the ears. Use small cuts for the curves.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a craft knife and cutting a detailed area of a paper design, with a dotted line indicating a curved cut.

steps.instruction: Take your time to ensure the cuts are neat.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a craft knife and cutting a paper design, with a focus on neatness.

steps.instruction: Turn the image upside down and cut out the grass. When this is complete, carefully cut away the remaining paper between the rabbits. Cut away from the joins to avoid over cutting.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a craft knife and cutting away paper from a design that is turned upside down, showing cut-out grass and areas between rabbits.

steps.instruction: Working in a clockwise direction, cut one side of each petal at the bottom towards the centre of each flower. Then cut the other side of each petal working in the other direction.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of a paper cutting project showing a hand using a craft knife to cut the petals of flowers.

tips: Use small cuts for the curves.
Take your time to ensure the cuts are neat.
Cut away from the joins to avoid over cutting.

size of the glass in your frame
size of the glass in your frame

steps.instruction: Working around the edges, begin to cut away the rest of the image. Take your time, especially with smaller areas such as the stars and leaves.

projects.name: Papercut locket

materials.dimensions: small enough to fit in a locket

steps.instruction: Measure the locket to ensure the papercut design can fit inside.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a ruler over an open, hexagonal locket with a chain, measuring its interior.

steps.instruction: Apply repositionable glue to the back of the papercut design so it doesn't smear the glass.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a small white papercut butterfly, applying glue to its back with a white glue pen. An open, hexagonal locket is visible in the background.

tips: With a little creativity, patience, and a very steady hand, you can adapt the same technique used for the nursery papercut to make something small enough to fit in a locket or a keyring.
Almost any simple shape will work, but as the papercut needs to be small, choose something without too much detail or it will be very hard to cut neatly.

projects.name: Intricate Paper-Cut Design

materials.dimensions: same size as the tape's border

steps.instruction: Prepare your template and begin to cut away the inside of one of the four panels. Make sure you keep the template right-side up during the whole cutting process.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of a hand holding a craft knife, beginning to cut intricate tree and floral patterns from the inside of a white paper template, which is placed on a green cutting mat. Small cut-out pieces are visible.

steps.instruction: Once you’ve finished cutting the inside of the first panel, cut out the pattern above it. Repeat this process, going from one side of the template to the other.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of a hand holding a craft knife, continuing to cut intricate tree and floral patterns from the white paper template on a green cutting mat. More of the pattern is now cut out compared to step 1.

steps.instruction: Continue until all of the excess paper has been cut away. You may need to change your blade several times to avoid creating frayed edges.
steps.visual_description: A fully cut-out white paper template with intricate tree, bird, and floral patterns, lying on a green cutting mat. A craft knife is resting on the mat, and small discarded paper pieces are scattered around.

steps.instruction: Apply thin double-sided tape to the edges of the panels. Before peeling off the second side, measure and cut four tracing paper rectangles the same size as the tape’s border.
dimensions_mentioned: same size as the tape’s border

details.description: Intricate design featuring trees, branches, leaves, birds, and flowers, forming a decorative border or central motif.

tips: Change your blade several times to avoid creating frayed edges during cutting.

steps.instruction: Peel back the other half of the tape and carefully stick the tracing paper on top. Repeat this process until the tracing paper covers all four panels.
steps.visual_description: A hand is peeling back a strip of tape from a white paper cut-out with a tree and flower design. The paper cut-out is on a green cutting mat. Another hand is holding the paper cut-out in place.

steps.instruction: Fold all of the flaps and side lines, making sure that there’s a stiff crease on all the edges. This will ensure that the lantern will stand up straight when finished.
steps.visual_description: A hand is creasing a folded edge of a white paper cut-out with a tree and flower design. A ruler is visible along the edge being creased. The paper cut-out is on a green cutting mat.

steps.instruction: Glue or tape all of the flaps in place, holding them in position for a short while to make sure they stick properly. To finish, add a flameless candle or fairy lights.

tips: To finish, add a flameless candle or fairy lights.

materials.dimensions: slightly larger than tissue paper sheets

steps.instruction: Cut the tissue paper to 50 sheets of the same size.

steps.instruction: Add double-sided tape to the 1st, 3rd, and 5th guide lines.

steps.instruction: Cut a semi circle from card that lines up with your outer borders and draw around it.

steps.instruction: Carefully cut out all your sheets.

steps.instruction: Cut two card arches the same size as your sheets.

projects.name: Origami fairy lights

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half diagonally, then unfold and fold along the other diagonal.
steps.visual_description: A green square of paper with two diagonal crease lines, forming an 'X' across the square.

steps.instruction: Fold in half horizontally, then unfold and fold again.
steps.visual_description: A green square of paper showing the two diagonal creases from step 1, and a new horizontal crease line across the middle.

tips: Experiment with a variety of paper opacity to get the right look depending on the strength of your LED lights.

diagram_descriptions: Image showing a stack of colorful square papers (green, pink, purple, light blue, yellow) and a string of LED fairy lights, labeled 'Squares of thin paper' and 'LED fairy lights' respectively.
Diagram 1: A green square of paper with two diagonal fold lines, creating an 'X' pattern.
Diagram 2: A green square of paper with the two diagonal fold lines and an additional horizontal fold line across the center.

steps.instruction: Turn the paper over.
steps.visual_description: A green square piece of paper is shown, with visible diagonal creases forming an 'X' and horizontal/vertical creases forming a '+' in the center, indicating previous folds. The paper is now turned to its reverse side.

steps.instruction: Push in the right and left horizontal folds, then flatten to create a layered triangle shape.
steps.visual_description: The green paper is now folded into a layered triangle shape. The top layer forms a triangle with its base at the bottom and apex at the top. Two additional triangular layers are visible underneath the top layer, indicating the 'pushing in' of the horizontal folds.

steps.instruction: Fold up the bottom corners as shown, then repeat on the back to form a diamond.
steps.visual_description: Starting from the layered triangle shape, the bottom two corners of the top layer are folded upwards along the central vertical line, creating two smaller triangles pointing towards the top. The overall shape now resembles a diamond with a flattened top edge.

steps.instruction: Fold the front edges inward as shown, then repeat on the back.
steps.visual_description: From the diamond shape, the side edges of the front layer are folded inward towards the central vertical line. These new folds are parallel to the center, resulting in a narrower, more refined diamond shape.

projects.name: Origami Fairy Lights

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom right corner up so it runs horizontally across the middle.
steps.visual_description: A green origami piece with the bottom right corner folded upwards to meet the horizontal center line.

steps.instruction: Fold it back to the bottom, then refold up at a right angle as shown.
steps.visual_description: The origami piece from step 7 is shown with the previously folded corner now folded back down and then up again at a right angle.

steps.instruction: Tuck the fold into the triangle at the side.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown tucking a folded flap into a triangular pocket on the side of the origami piece.

steps.instruction: Repeat with the other corners. Pull the paper apart and blow into the centre hole to inflate.
steps.visual_description: Two hands are pulling apart the sides of the origami piece, revealing a central hole. The piece is starting to inflate.

projects.name: Accordion Fan Decoration

steps.instruction: Score equally-spaced vertical lines on several sheets of paper. The more sheets you use and the wider the lines, the bigger the fan will be. Use the guides on your cutting mat to make sure the lines are straight.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a scoring tool and ruler, scoring vertical lines on a sheet of pink paper on a cutting mat.

steps.instruction: Apply PVA glue to the bottom segment of one of the sheets of paper. Stick the top segment of another sheet of paper on top so they overlap. Allow to dry and then repeat with the other sheets (minimum of two).
steps.visual_description: A hand applying PVA glue to the bottom edge of a pink paper sheet, and another hand placing another pink paper sheet on top, overlapping.

steps.instruction: Fold the papers along the scored creases to create an accordion effect.
steps.visual_description: A stack of pink papers folded along scored creases, showing the accordion effect.

steps.instruction: Repeat this process with slimmer sheets of paper of a different colour. When done, lay them flat and cut shapes into the folds to add detail.
steps.visual_description: A finished accordion fan made of patterned paper, lying flat on a cutting mat with small cut-out shapes scattered around it, next to a craft knife.

tips: The more sheets you use and the wider the lines, the bigger the fan will be.
projects.finished_product_description: An accordion fan made of folded and glued paper, with decorative shapes cut into the folds.

diagram_descriptions: Image 1: Close-up of a hand scoring vertical lines on pink paper with a ruler and scoring tool on a cutting mat.
Image 2: Close-up of a hand applying PVA glue to pink paper and overlapping another sheet.
Image 3: Close-up of a stack of pink papers folded into an accordion shape.
Image 4: A finished accordion fan made of patterned paper, lying flat on a cutting mat with cut-out shapes and a craft knife.

projects.name: Hanging Fan

steps.instruction: Repeat again with another thinner paper. However, instead of cutting a design in the folds, slice the ends off diagonally.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of hands using a craft knife to slice the folded edges of teal paper diagonally. The paper is folded in a fan shape.

steps.instruction: Use a glue stick to attach the second paper to the first and allow to dry. Then apply glue to the bottom of the third.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of hands using a glue stick to attach a yellow patterned paper strip to a pink folded paper strip. The strips are arranged in a fan shape.

steps.instruction: Glue the third paper along the bottom edge of the fan. Take your time to ensure the edges align properly.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of hands gluing a teal patterned paper strip to the bottom edge of a fan made of folded paper strips. The instruction 'Make sure to glue firmly' is visible with a dotted line pointing to the glued edge.

tips: Make sure to glue firmly.
projects.finished_product_description: A hanging fan constructed from folded and glued paper strips in various colors and patterns.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 5 shows a close-up of hands using a craft knife to slice the folded edges of teal paper diagonally. The paper is folded in a fan shape.
Diagram 6 shows a close-up of hands using a glue stick to attach a yellow patterned paper strip to a pink folded paper strip. The strips are arranged in a fan shape.

Diagram 7 shows a close-up of hands gluing a teal patterned paper strip to the bottom edge of a fan made of folded paper strips. The instruction 'Make sure to glue firmly' is visible with a dotted line pointing to the glued edge.

projects.name: Decorations

materials.color: one plain, one with coloured paper

steps.instruction: Apply PVA glue to one of the ends of the accordion-folded paper, then bring the two sides of the accordion together to form a large circle.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a paintbrush applies white PVA glue to the end of a red and patterned accordion-folded paper strip. A small clear bowl of white glue is next to it on a light brown surface.

steps.instruction: Lay the formed paper fan (rosette) on greaseproof paper and use a hot glue gun to create a pool of glue in the centre.
steps.visual_description: A pink hot glue gun is dispensing hot glue into the center of a circular, patterned paper fan (rosette) which is resting on greaseproof paper.

steps.instruction: Using both hands, carefully squeeze the fan inward so the centre moves toward the glue and shrinks. Hold in place until the glue sets then peel away the greaseproof paper.
steps.visual_description: Two hands are pressing down on the center of the circular paper fan, squeezing it inwards to secure the center, while it rests on greaseproof paper.

steps.instruction: Use the inside ring of a roll of sticky tape to mark two discs from card. One disc should be plain, and the other one should have coloured paper stuck to it. Neatly cut out the discs.
steps.visual_description: A roll of clear sticky tape, a pen, a craft knife, and a cutting mat are shown. A piece of brown cardstock has a circular hole cut out, and two circular discs are visible: one plain brown and one covered with patterned paper (green/pink pattern).

pieces.name: disc
pieces.width: diameter of inside ring of sticky tape roll
pieces.height: diameter of inside ring of sticky tape roll

details.description: one plain card, one card with coloured paper

projects.finished_product_description: A decorative paper rosette or fan with a secured center, possibly embellished with card discs.

diagram_descriptions: Step 8: Close-up of a hand applying PVA glue to the end of an accordion-folded paper strip.
Step 9: Close-up of a hot glue gun applying glue to the center of a circular paper fan.
Step 10: Close-up of two hands pressing the center of a paper fan to secure it.
Step 11: Arrangement of craft tools (sticky tape roll, pen, craft knife, cutting mat) and cut card discs (plain and patterned).

projects.name: Hanging Fan

steps.instruction: Turn the fan on its back and stick the plain disc to the centre with hot glue. Fold a ribbon in half, place the opposite ends on top, then stick the second disc on top with more hot glue.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown placing a decorative disc with a green and pink pattern onto a pink pleated fan that has a layer of glue on its center. Another disc is being placed on top of the ribbon ends.

steps.instruction: Lay the folded ribbon between one of the fan’s folds, then secure in place with a strip of paper and some PVA glue.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown securing a folded purple ribbon to the fan with a strip of paper and glue. The ribbon is tucked between the pleats of the pink fan.

steps.instruction: Cover the hole on the front of your fan with buttons or beads.
steps.visual_description: The front of the completed hanging fan is shown, decorated with a central embellishment of buttons or beads.

projects.finished_product_description: A decorative hanging fan made of pink pleated paper, adorned with patterned discs and a ribbon loop for hanging. The center is decorated with buttons or beads.

diagram_descriptions: Image 12 shows a close-up of hands attaching decorative discs to the center of a pink pleated fan using hot glue.
Image 13 shows a close-up of hands securing a folded purple ribbon to the pink pleated fan using a strip of paper and glue.
Image 14 shows a close-up of the completed hanging fan, featuring a central embellishment of buttons or beads on the front.
A garland of folded paper ornaments and beads hangs from the back of a light blue wooden chair. The background is a light blue wallpaper with a pattern of white horizontal wavy lines and small dots.

A collection of rolled papers with different patterns and colors, tied with blue string. To the right are craft supplies including a jar of white glue with a brush, a glue stick, a spool of blue string, a pair of scissors, a small bowl of blue and clear beads, and a pink circle punch. A piece of cardboard is visible behind the glue and brush, labeled as a scrap surface. The text 'You will need' is in a pink rounded rectangle in the bottom left.
A close-up of various rolled papers with floral and abstract patterns in colors like green, yellow, gold, teal, and purple. Some are tied with blue string.

A close-up of craft supplies including a jar of white PVA glue with a brush, a glue stick, a spool of blue string, scissors, a bowl of blue beads, and a pink circle punch. A piece of cardboard is visible behind the glue and brush.

A close-up of a bowl filled with various blue and clear beads.

projects.name: Paper Ball Decoration

steps.instruction: Use a punch to cut out circles. You will need six per ball.
steps.visual_description: A hand is using a purple punch to cut a circle from patterned paper. Several cut circles are visible on the paper.

steps.instruction: Fold the circles in half, image sides together.
steps.visual_description: Hands are folding a white paper circle in half, with the patterned side facing inwards. Other folded circles are visible.

steps.instruction: Begin gluing the folded circles on top of each other.
steps.visual_description: A hand is applying glue from a glue stick to the edge of a folded blue paper circle, which is placed on top of another folded circle.

steps.instruction: Repeat until all the folded circles are glued together.
steps.visual_description: A hand is pressing down on a stack of folded paper circles that are being glued together. The stack is forming a rounded shape.

tips: Use a punch for clean holes
projects.finished_product_description: A decorative ball made from glued, folded paper circles.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A hand using a punch to cut circles from patterned paper.
Diagram 2: Hands folding paper circles in half.
Diagram 3: A hand gluing folded paper circles together.
Diagram 4: A hand pressing down on a stack of glued folded paper circles.

projects.name: Hanging Garlands

steps.instruction: Make two knots on a length of string and glue it between the circles. Close the circles around the string and glue in place.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a blue string with two knots tied on it, which is being threaded through a folded paper circle. The paper circle is attached to a piece of cardboard.

steps.instruction: Apply a little glue to the end of the string to stop it from fraying.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a blue string with a paintbrush applying glue to the frayed end of the string.

steps.instruction: Thread beads onto the string and make a loop at the end.
steps.visual_description: A hand threading colorful beads onto a blue string. A loop is being formed at the end of the string.

steps.instruction: Repeat the steps to make more balls for your garland.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of a garland made of folded paper balls and beads. Several colorful beads and paper balls are visible, connected by a blue string.

projects.finished_product_description: A garland made of folded paper balls and beads.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 5 shows a hand threading a blue string with two knots through a folded paper circle.
Diagram 6 shows a paintbrush applying glue to the end of a blue string.
Diagram 7 shows a hand threading beads onto a blue string and forming a loop.
Diagram 8 shows a section of a finished garland with multiple folded paper balls and beads strung together.

projects.name: Paper Feather Headdress

materials.color: red, orange, yellow, light blue, teal, dark red
blue with floral pattern, green with floral pattern

steps.instruction: Cut out feather shapes from colored cardstock and patterned paper. The shapes should be elongated with jagged edges along one side to resemble feathers.
steps.visual_description: Various paper shapes cut to resemble feathers in different colors and patterns.

steps.instruction: Cut a strip of white cardstock to fit around the child's head. This will form the base of the headdress.
steps.visual_description: A white paper strip.

steps.instruction: Arrange the paper feathers along the top edge of the white cardstock strip, overlapping them slightly. Vary the colors and patterns for a dynamic look.
steps.visual_description: Paper feathers being arranged on a white band.

steps.instruction: Secure the feathers to the white cardstock band. This can be done with glue or tape.
steps.visual_description: Feathers attached to the white band.

steps.instruction: Wrap the band around the child's head and secure the ends to form the headdress.
steps.visual_description: The completed headdress being worn by a child.

tips: Use a variety of colors and patterns for a more interesting headdress.
Cut the feather shapes in different sizes for added dimension.
projects.finished_product_description: A colorful headdress made of paper feathers attached to a white band, worn by a smiling young boy.

diagram_descriptions: A young boy wearing a colorful paper feather headdress and a striped t-shirt with an orange pocket. He has his arms crossed and is smiling at the camera. The background is plain white.

projects.name: Origami Birds
projects.finished_product_description: Several origami birds made from patterned and solid colored paper, decorated with paper leaves and standing on small cardboard bases.

diagram_descriptions: A collection of origami birds in various colors and patterns, some with green paper leaves attached as if they are holding them or have them as tails. The birds are arranged on a light blue surface, with some on small circular cardboard bases.

projects.name: Origami bird
projects.finished_product_description: Cute little origami birds that can be used as decorations or place holders.

diagram_descriptions: A flat lay of craft supplies including a ruler, hole punch, scalpel, circle punch, cutting mat, scissors, hot glue gun, glue bottle, and spray mount. Various colored and patterned squares of paper are fanned out on the cutting mat. The title 'Origami bird' is at the top left, and the text 'You will need' is on a purple tag at the bottom right.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half diagonally.
steps.visual_description: A hand is shown folding a square piece of patterned paper diagonally. The paper is blue with a floral pattern of pink and white flowers and green leaves. The fold creates a triangle.

steps.instruction: Open out, then fold two sides in as shown.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 1 is opened out and then the two side edges are folded inwards towards the center crease, creating a kite shape. The top part of the paper is purple.

steps.instruction: Turn the paper over and fold the top down.
steps.visual_description: The kite-shaped paper is turned over. The top point of the purple section is folded down.

steps.instruction: Turn it back over and fold down the corners.
steps.visual_description: The paper is turned back over. The two top corners of the patterned paper section are folded down.

steps.instruction: Lift up each flap, pull the top corner to the side, then fold back down as shown.
steps.visual_description: The two flaps created in step 2 are lifted up. The top corner of each flap is pulled outwards to the side and then folded back down, creating wing-like shapes.

steps.instruction: Tuck the corners underneath so they poke out a little.
steps.visual_description: The corners that were pulled to the side in the previous step are tucked underneath the main body of the origami, with a small portion still visible, resembling feet.

steps.instruction: Fold the bird in half so that the open fold is at the top, then fold the middle in to create a beak.
steps.visual_description: The entire origami shape is folded in half vertically, with the open edges at the top. The front point is then folded inwards and slightly upwards to form a beak.

projects.finished_product_description: A small origami bird with a patterned body and a purple head, with a beak formed from the front point.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1 shows a hand folding a patterned paper diagonally.
Diagram 1 (continued) shows the paper opened and sides folded in.
Diagram 2 shows the paper turned over and the top folded down.
Diagram 2 (continued) shows the paper turned back over and corners folded down.
Diagram 3 shows the flaps being lifted and folded to create wings.
Diagram 3 (continued) shows the corners tucked underneath to form feet.
Diagram 4 shows the bird folded in half and the beak being formed.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Fold the tail along the top towards the head.
steps.visual_description: Hands folding the tail of a blue and pink floral origami bird towards its head.

steps.instruction: Open up the tail and fold the bottom section inside using the crease lines as a guide.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded origami bird with a purple head and blue floral body, showing the tail section being folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Cut out a disc of card with a circle punch. Stick the bird's feet to the disc using hot glue.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a brown card disc with two drops of hot glue on it, and the feet of an origami bird being positioned to attach.

steps.instruction: To make the eyes, glue on two paper circles made by a hole punch, and colour in each centre.
steps.visual_description: A finished origami bird standing on a brown disc, with two small white paper circles glued on as eyes, and a pen nearby. Green paper leaves are also visible.

tips: Use screw punch for clean holes
projects.finished_product_description: A decorative origami bird with a blue floral body and purple head, standing on a brown disc.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 5: Folding the tail of the origami bird.
Diagram showing step 6: Folding the tail section inwards.
Diagram showing step 7: Attaching the bird's feet to a card disc with hot glue.
Diagram showing step 8: The finished origami bird with paper circle eyes, standing on a disc, with a pen and leaves nearby.

projects.name: Owl Mobile

materials.color: purple, pink, blue, green, yellow, white, silver

steps.instruction: Cut out owl shapes from cardstock in various colors.
steps.visual_description: Various colored owl shapes.

steps.instruction: Cut out wing shapes, body shapes, and facial features for each owl.
steps.visual_description: Individual paper pieces for owl features.

steps.instruction: Cut out star shapes from silver cardstock.
steps.visual_description: Silver star shapes.

steps.instruction: Cut out leaf shapes from green cardstock.
steps.visual_description: Green leaf shapes.

steps.instruction: Assemble the owls by gluing the features onto the body shapes.
steps.visual_description: Partially assembled owls.

steps.instruction: Wrap a cardboard tube with patterned paper to create a branch.
steps.visual_description: Cardboard tube covered in patterned paper.

steps.instruction: Attach the assembled owls to the branch using glue.
steps.visual_description: Owls attached to the patterned tube.

steps.instruction: Cut lengths of purple string.
steps.visual_description: Lengths of purple string.

steps.instruction: Tie the owls and stars to the string.
steps.visual_description: Owls and stars suspended from strings.

steps.instruction: Create a hanging structure by tying strings to a blue hoop.
steps.visual_description: Blue hoop with strings attached.

steps.instruction: Attach the branch with owls and stars to the hoop.
steps.visual_description: Mobile structure with owls, stars, and branch.

steps.instruction: Add green leaf shapes to the branch.
steps.visual_description: Leaves attached to the branch.

projects.finished_product_description: A colorful mobile featuring paper owls perched on a branch, with stars and leaves hanging from a blue hoop.

diagram_descriptions: A mobile made of colorful paper owls, silver stars, and green leaves hanging from a blue hoop. The owls are perched on a blue tube wrapped in patterned paper. The background is light blue with a white dotted pattern.

projects.name: Owl mobile
projects.finished_product_description: A cheerful mobile decoration for a child's bed.

diagram_descriptions: A flat lay of materials and tools needed for the Owl mobile project. The materials include stacks of colored paper and patterned cardstock, rolls of masking tape and double-sided tape, spools of white and dark purple thread, a small container of colorful beads, tracing paper, metallic card, glittered card, and sticky pads. Tools shown are an embroidery hoop, a cutting mat, a scalpel, a scorer, a pencil, and scissors. Labels point to each item.

projects.name: Making the owls

steps.instruction: Fold a sheet of paper in half inward. Trace all the pieces of the template.
steps.visual_description: Hands folding a sheet of paper with a geometric pattern on one side, preparing to trace template pieces.

steps.instruction: Place the owl's body face down on the folded paper. Rub to transfer.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a pencil is rubbing over a template of an owl's body placed face down on folded paper, transferring the design.

steps.instruction: Cut out the eyes and bodies to make two halves of your owl.
steps.visual_description: A hand is using a craft knife to cut out the eye shapes from a paper template on a cutting mat.

steps.instruction: Transfer and cut out all the other template pieces.
steps.visual_description: Hands are using scissors to cut out pink and purple paper pieces that are templates for owl parts, with drawn lines visible on the pink piece.

projects.finished_product_description: A colorful owl made from paper, perched on a branch.

diagram_descriptions: A finished owl craft made of purple, pink, and blue paper, with teal wings, perched on a green branch with leaves.
The number '86' is visible on the branch near the owl.

projects.name: Owl Mobile

steps.instruction: Cut "U" shapes into the breast to make feathers.
steps.visual_description: A hand using scissors to cut U-shaped notches into a pink paper oval shape on a cutting mat.

steps.instruction: Gently fold and push out the feathers.
steps.visual_description: A hand gently folding and pushing out the U-shaped cuts on the pink paper oval to create feather texture.

steps.instruction: Fold the top and glue on a coloured triangle for a beak.
steps.visual_description: A hand folding a piece of patterned paper and gluing a small blue triangle onto it to form a beak.

steps.instruction: Glue the breast, being careful not to stick the feathers down. Repeat for the owl's other half.
steps.visual_description: A hand gluing the pink feathered breast piece onto a patterned paper owl body, avoiding the feather edges. The patterned paper has two circular eye holes.

steps.instruction: Stick thin strips of double-sided tape above and below the eyes, then stretch a piece of cotton thread between them.
steps.visual_description: A hand applying double-sided tape around the eye holes of a white paper owl body, and then stretching a white thread between the tape strips.

steps.instruction: Tape a 40cm (15in) piece of dark thread to the centre of the owl (but not the beak). Then stick or glue the two halves together.
steps.visual_description: A hand taping a dark thread to the center of a patterned paper owl half, and then preparing to join it with another half.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper owl mobile with patterned wings and feathered breast.

diagram_descriptions: The page shows steps 5, 6, 7, and 8 for creating an owl mobile. Step 5 shows cutting and shaping feathers on a pink oval. Step 6 shows attaching a beak and gluing the breast onto a patterned owl body. Step 7 shows applying tape and thread for hanging. Step 8 shows taping the hanging thread and preparing to glue the owl halves together. The title 'OWL MOBILE' is at the top right.
A small illustration of a colorful owl with the number 87 on its chest is in the bottom right corner.

projects.name: Paper Owls

steps.instruction: Use double-sided tape or glue to attach the wings to the body.
steps.visual_description: Hands are shown attaching a purple paper wing to the body of a paper owl using double-sided tape.

steps.instruction: Cut four circles and glue to either side of the thread between the eyes. Secure the beak with a sticky pad.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of a paper owl's face. Four small circles are being glued on either side of a thread, and a beak is being attached with a sticky pad.

steps.instruction: Roll a piece of paper around a pencil and glue to make a branch. Remove the pencil.
steps.visual_description: Hands are shown rolling a piece of paper around a pencil and securing it with glue to create a branch shape.

steps.instruction: Attach leaves with tape or glue.
steps.visual_description: Hands are shown attaching green paper leaves to the paper branch with tape.

steps.instruction: Cut a slot in the branch for the owl and glue it in place. Repeat to make the other four owls.
steps.visual_description: A paper owl is being inserted into a slot cut into the paper branch and glued in place. The branch is blue with green polka dots.

projects.finished_product_description: A craft project featuring multiple paper owls attached to a paper branch.

diagram_descriptions: Image 9: Close-up of hands using double-sided tape to attach a purple paper wing to a paper owl body.
Image 10: Close-up of a paper owl's face, showing the attachment of small circles around the eyes and a beak.
Image 11: Close-up of hands rolling a piece of paper around a pencil to form a branch, with glue being applied.
Image 12: Close-up of hands attaching green paper leaves to a blue, polka-dotted paper branch using tape.
Image 13: Close-up of a paper owl being inserted and glued into a slot on the paper branch.

steps.instruction: Cut stars from glittery paper and tape over the thread hanging above the owls.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding scissors cutting a star shape from glittery paper. A purple thread is visible, with a star already taped to it, and another star being cut to be taped.

steps.instruction: Fold metallic paper in half and cut 12 semi circles at the folded edge. Stick the folded circles on top of each other.
steps.visual_description: Top image shows a hand holding scissors cutting a semi-circle from a piece of metallic paper folded in half. Bottom image shows a stack of folded semi-circles being held by a hand, demonstrating them stuck together.

steps.instruction: Tie a bead to a piece of thread and place it in the seam between the circles. Stick the final pieces of the circle together to form a ball.
steps.visual_description: Top image shows a hand holding a stack of folded circles with a white bead tied to a purple thread, placed in the seam between the circles. Bottom image shows a hand sticking the last pieces of the folded circles together to form a spherical shape.

steps.instruction: Paint the embroidery hoop and tie thread across its diameter four times. Tie the ball where the threads meet, leaving a slight drop, then tie the owls to the hoop.
steps.visual_description: A blue painted embroidery hoop with purple threads tied across its diameter four times, creating an intersecting pattern in the center. The completed paper ball is tied to the center intersection of the threads. A hand is pointing to a knot on the hoop, indicating where owls should be tied.

projects.name: Crown

steps.instruction: Trace the templates and lay them face down on card. Rub with a pencil to transfer the image.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a paper template with pencil lines, placing it onto a piece of cardstock.

steps.instruction: Cut out the shapes with a scalpel, using a ruler to make sure the cuts are straight.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a scalpel and ruler, cutting along a line on a piece of cardstock. Several cut-out shapes are visible.

steps.instruction: Apply glue to the points of the crown.

steps.instruction: Stick the other card on top so the two pieces properly align.
steps.visual_description: A hand placing a second cut-out crown shape on top of the first, aligning the points.

projects.name: PARTY CROWN

steps.instruction: When dry, stick down the rest of the crown.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a piece of cut-out paper (part of the crown) over a blue cutting mat, with another hand applying glue to the paper with a brush. The paper has intricate, spiky cut-outs along one edge.

steps.instruction: Cut a length of string to the circumference of the child’s head. Lay it across the strap so one end touches the edge of the card. Place a sticky pad at the other end of the string.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a long, thin strip of silver-colored paper (the crown strap) with a blue string laid across it. Scissors are visible in the background. The string is positioned so one end is near the edge of the strap.

steps.instruction: Peel the back off the sticky pad and stick down the strap.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of a hand peeling the backing off a small, white sticky pad attached to the end of a silver-colored paper strap.

steps.instruction: Trim and neaten any overhang or rough edges.
steps.visual_description: A finished silver-colored crown with intricate, spiky and geometric cut-outs, standing upright on a light wooden surface. The crown forms a circular shape.

pieces.name: crown_band
pieces.shape: long strip with one edge cut into a spiky, geometric pattern

details.description: spiky, triangular, and diamond-shaped cut-outs along the top edge

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Form the strip into a circle, securing the ends with glue and a sticky pad, with a string laid across the join for adjustable sizing.

projects.finished_product_description: A silver-colored party crown with a spiky, geometric cut-out design, secured with a string at the back.

projects.name: Paper Daffodils

steps.instruction: Cut out 6 petals from yellow cardstock and 4 petals from white cardstock. Each petal should be approximately 2 inches long and 1 inch wide at its widest point, with a slightly pointed tip.
steps.visual_description: Several oval-shaped pieces of paper with one pointed end.

steps.instruction: Cut out 5 trumpet shapes from orange cardstock. Each trumpet should be about 1 inch tall and 0.75 inches wide at the top, tapering to a point at the bottom.
steps.visual_description: Small, cone-shaped pieces of paper.

steps.instruction: Cut out 6 leaf shapes from green cardstock. Each leaf should be about 4 inches long and 1 inch wide at its widest point, with a slightly curved edge.
steps.visual_description: Long, oval-shaped pieces of green paper with a gentle curve.

steps.instruction: For each flower, take one trumpet shape and gently curl the edges inward. Glue it to the center of a petal cluster (3 yellow or 2 white petals).
steps.visual_description: A trumpet shape is placed in the center of several petals.

steps.instruction: Continue adding petals around the trumpet, overlapping them slightly, until you have a full flower shape. Use 3 yellow petals for the yellow flowers and 2 white petals for the white flowers.
steps.visual_description: Petals are layered around a central trumpet to form a flower.

steps.instruction: Wrap a piece of floral wire around the base of each flower and secure with floral tape, extending the tape down the wire to form the stem.
steps.visual_description: A wire is attached to the base of a flower and wrapped with tape.

steps.instruction: Attach 1-2 green leaves to each stem, wrapping them with floral tape.
steps.visual_description: Green leaves are attached to the taped stem.

steps.instruction: Arrange the finished flowers into a bouquet. Wrap the stems with brown kraft paper, securing with floral tape.
steps.visual_description: Several flower stems are bundled together and wrapped in brown paper.

steps.instruction: Tie the beige ribbon around the kraft paper-wrapped stems.
steps.visual_description: A ribbon is tied in a bow around the bouquet's stems.

tips: Gently curl the edges of the petals with your finger or a pencil for a more realistic look.
Use a glue gun for quick and strong adhesion.
projects.finished_product_description: A bouquet of handmade daffodils, some yellow and some white with orange centers, wrapped in brown kraft paper and tied with a beige ribbon.

diagram_descriptions: A top-down view of a bouquet of handmade daffodils. The bouquet is arranged on a piece of brown kraft paper, with a beige ribbon tied around the stems. The daffodils have yellow or white petals and orange or yellow centers. Green leaves are attached to the stems. The background is a textured, light gray surface.

projects.name: Paper Flowers

steps.instruction: Trace the templates and place upside down on card. Rub with a pencil to transfer.
steps.visual_description: A hand is holding a piece of paper with a petal shape traced on it, placing it upside down on a piece of grey cardstock. A pencil is visible in the background.

steps.instruction: Cut out the petals. You will need five for each blossom.
steps.visual_description: A pair of scissors is cutting out a stack of pink tissue paper petals. The stack appears to be five layers thick.

steps.instruction: Gently stretch the centre papers between your fingers.
steps.visual_description: A hand is gently stretching a strip of pink tissue paper between the thumb and index finger.

steps.instruction: Fringe the centre papers finely, about 1cm (1⁄2in) deep. Roll the centres between your fingers and glue the opposite ends.
steps.visual_description: The top image shows scissors fringing the edge of a pink tissue paper strip. The bottom image shows a hand rolling a fringed strip of pink tissue paper and applying glue to one end.

projects.finished_product_description: Pink paper flowers attached to thin brown branches against a light blue background.

templates.name: Petal template
templates.shape_description: A curved, teardrop-like shape with a pointed end.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A hand tracing a petal template onto grey cardstock with a pencil.
Diagram 2: Scissors cutting out a stack of pink tissue paper petals.
Diagram 3: A hand stretching a strip of pink tissue paper.
Diagram 4: Top part shows scissors fringing the edge of a pink tissue paper strip. Bottom part shows a hand rolling a fringed strip and applying glue.
Bottom image: A display of finished pink paper flowers on thin brown branches against a light blue background.

projects.name: Cherry Blossom

steps.instruction: Cup the petals between your fingers to shape them.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of hands holding a light pink petal, cupping it between thumb and forefinger. Two other shaped petals are visible on a light grey surface below.

steps.instruction: Glue the petals around the centre at the bottom of the fringing, overlapping halfway across each petal.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of hands holding a partially assembled light pink flower. One petal is being glued around a red fringed center, overlapping another petal. The flower is cupped.

steps.instruction: Once dry, cut the stems to 0.5cm (1/4in). Gently squeeze the petals down to form the blossom.
steps.visual_description: Overhead shot of a light grey surface with craft items. A pair of silver scissors is on the left. In the center, a fully formed light pink blossom with a short stem is shown, with a dotted line indicating where to cut the stem to 0.5cm (1/4in). Two cut stem pieces are next to the scissors. To the right, two more partially assembled blossoms with longer stems are visible, one with a red fringed center.

steps.instruction: Hot glue onto the branch at the point you wish. Try gluing the blossoms in clusters for a realistic look.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of hands hot gluing a light pink blossom onto a brown branch. A drop of hot glue is visible on the branch where the blossom is being attached.

tips: Try gluing the blossoms in clusters for a realistic look.
projects.finished_product_description: A brown branch adorned with multiple pink cherry blossoms, some in clusters, against a light blue background.

Image 6: Close-up of hands holding a partially assembled light pink flower. One petal is being glued around a red fringed center, overlapping another petal. The flower is cupped.

Image 7: Overhead shot of a light grey surface with craft items. A pair of silver scissors is on the left. In the center, a fully formed light pink blossom with a short stem is shown, with a dotted line indicating where to cut the stem to 0.5cm (1/4in). Two cut stem pieces are next to the scissors. To the right, two more partially assembled blossoms with longer stems are visible, one with a red fringed center.
Image 8: Close-up of hands hot gluing a light pink blossom onto a brown branch. A drop of hot glue is visible on the branch where the blossom is being attached.

projects.name: Crepe Paper Flower

steps.instruction: Place florist’s wire at one end of a small piece of fringed crepe paper. Add glue and roll the paper around the wire.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a florist's wire and a small piece of yellow fringed crepe paper, with the paper being rolled around the wire.

steps.instruction: Cut orange paper for the trumpet and brush the edge with red paint.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding a piece of orange crepe paper and a paintbrush with red paint, brushing the edge of the paper. A palette with yellow and red paint is visible.

steps.instruction: Lightly spray some spray mount over a sheet of crepe paper. Cut out six petals for each flower.
steps.visual_description: A hand spraying a can of spray mount over a sheet of yellow crepe paper. Another hand is visible on the right, indicating the paper.

steps.instruction: Pinch the top of the petal until it forms a realistic shape. Shape the petals with your thumbs.
steps.visual_description: Two yellow crepe paper petals on a textured surface. A dotted line indicates pinching the top of one petal to form a realistic shape. The text 'Shape the petals with your thumbs' is below.

steps.instruction: Once dry, wrap the trumpet around the stamens and secure with wire.
steps.visual_description: An orange crepe paper trumpet shape, secured at the top with wire, with yellow stamens inside.

projects.finished_product_description: A handmade crepe paper flower with orange trumpet and yellow petals.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1 shows a close-up of hands preparing the base of a flower by rolling fringed yellow crepe paper around a green florist's wire.
Diagram 2 shows a close-up of hands painting the edge of an orange crepe paper piece with red paint from a palette.
Diagram 3 shows a hand spraying a can of spray mount onto a sheet of yellow crepe paper.
Diagram 4 shows two shaped yellow crepe paper petals on a textured surface, with an instruction to pinch the top to form a realistic shape.
An additional image shows a finished orange crepe paper trumpet shape with yellow stamens, secured with wire.

projects.name: Daffodil

steps.instruction: With your finger and thumb, gently stretch the trumpet part of the flower.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding an orange paper trumpet shape and gently stretching its opening with a thumb and finger.

steps.instruction: Arrange the petals around the stem. Wrap strips of green paper diagonally around the stem to hold in place.
steps.visual_description: A hand arranging yellow paper petals around a green stem. Green paper strips are being wrapped diagonally around the stem.

steps.instruction: Add some green leaves to the stem; glue and hold in place with strips of paper.
steps.visual_description: A hand gluing green paper leaves to a green stem and holding them in place with strips of paper.

steps.instruction: Glue between the trumpet and the petals. Squeeze gently into shape.
steps.visual_description: A hand applying glue between the orange trumpet and yellow petals of a daffodil. The flower is being gently squeezed into shape.

projects.finished_product_description: A handmade daffodil flower.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 5 shows a hand gently stretching the opening of an orange paper trumpet.
Diagram 6 shows yellow paper petals being arranged around a green stem, with green paper strips being wrapped diagonally to secure them.
Diagram 7 shows green paper leaves being glued to a green stem and secured with paper strips.
Diagram 8 shows glue being applied between the trumpet and petals of the daffodil, and the flower being gently squeezed into shape.

projects.name: Large rose
projects.finished_product_description: Giant roses that are dramatic and delicate, perfect for a wedding or birthday party.

diagram_descriptions: A flat lay of materials and tools needed to create a large rose. From left to right: two rolls of crepe paper (one pink, one dark green), a wooden dowel rod, a bundle of green florist wire, an orange pencil, a pair of silver scissors, a roll of green floral tape, and a pink hot glue gun with a glue stick inserted. Labels point to each item: 'Crepe paper and cardboard', 'Dowelling rod', 'Strong florist wire', 'Round pencil', 'Scissors', 'Stem tape', and 'Hot glue gun and sticks'.

projects.name: Crepe Paper Flowers

steps.instruction: Copy the templates to cardboard and cut them out. Draw around them and cut out six small, ten medium, and six large petals from pink crepe paper. Then cut eight sepals and one large leaf from dark green crepe paper.
steps.visual_description: Hands holding a leaf-shaped cardboard template on pink crepe paper, with a pencil tracing the outline. The text indicates to cut out petals and sepals from crepe paper.

steps.instruction: Put two small petals to one side, then use a pencil to curl the tips of the remaining petals. Stretch the paper slightly as you roll it. For the large petals, roll each lobe separately.
steps.visual_description: Hands using a pencil to curl the edge of a pink crepe paper petal. The petal is being stretched slightly as it is rolled.

steps.instruction: Push your thumbs into the centre of the small petals to cup them. Push out the medium and large petals in the same way, but this time at three points on the petal.
steps.visual_description: Hands cupping a pink crepe paper petal by pushing inwards with thumbs from the center.

steps.instruction: Add a dab of hot glue to the bottom point of the two small, uncurled petals and attach them to the dowelling. Apply glue to the top of the rod and roll the petals into a spiral around it.
steps.visual_description: A pink hot glue gun is applying glue to a dowelling rod. Hands are attaching pink crepe paper petals to the rod.

projects.finished_product_description: A flower made from crepe paper petals attached to a dowelling rod.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1 shows hands holding a leaf-shaped template on pink crepe paper, with a pencil tracing the outline. Text says 'Hold template firmly.'
Diagram 2 shows hands using a pencil to curl the edge of a pink crepe paper petal.
Diagram 3 shows hands cupping a pink crepe paper petal by pushing inwards with thumbs from the center.
Diagram 4 shows a pink hot glue gun applying glue to a dowelling rod, with hands attaching pink crepe paper petals to the rod.

projects.name: Large Rose

steps.instruction: Going from small to large, attach the remaining petals in the same way, spacing by eye. Add glue further up the petal to keep the shape if need be. You also may have to stretch the base of the large petals to fit.
steps.visual_description: A hand is holding a partially formed pink paper rose, with the petals spiraling inwards towards the center. Another hand is shown attaching a new petal.

steps.instruction: For the sepals, slightly stretch the bottom of each one so that they fit around the base of the flower head. Then curl the points and glue them on, ensuring that some of the paper attaches to the dowelling.
steps.visual_description: Hands are shown attaching dark green paper sepals to the base of a pink paper rose. The sepals are being stretched and curled.

steps.instruction: Place a line of hot glue along the centre of the large green leaf and attach the floral wire. Fold the leaf in half and allow the hot glue to set before opening again.
steps.visual_description: A hand is holding a large, dark green paper leaf. A pink glue gun is applying a line of glue along the center of the leaf. A floral wire is being placed onto the glue line.

steps.instruction: Starting at the base of the rose, wind the stem tape around the dowelling. After a few turns, add the wired leaf, and glue it in place with the glue gun. Continue to wrap the stem tape around the dowelling until you reach the end.
steps.visual_description: Hands are shown wrapping dark green stem tape around a wooden dowel, which is the stem of the rose. A wired leaf is being attached to the stem with glue.

projects.finished_product_description: A large, pink paper rose with green sepals and a stem wrapped in green tape, with a wired leaf attached.

diagram_descriptions: Image 5: Close-up of a hand attaching a pink paper petal to a partially formed rose.
Image 6: Hands attaching dark green paper sepals to the base of a pink paper rose.
Image 7: A hand applying hot glue to the center of a large green paper leaf, with a floral wire being placed on the glue.
Image 8: Hands wrapping green stem tape around a wooden dowel, with a wired leaf being attached.

projects.name: Kusudama
projects.finished_product_description: Beautiful origami flowers that can liven up any room and be stuck to almost anything with a little glue.

diagram_descriptions: A top-down view of several folded squares of patterned paper in shades of yellow, blue, pink, and orange, fanned out on a white wooden surface. A tube of glue with a red cap is placed on top of some of the paper squares. Text labels point to 'Squares of paper' and 'Glue'. A light blue tag with rounded corners reads 'You will need'.

projects.name: Origami Flower

steps.instruction: Choose your paper colour. You'll need five squares per flower.
steps.visual_description: A single square of pink paper with a peacock feather pattern, lying flat.

steps.instruction: Fold into a triangle. Fold both the bottom corners up to the middle.
steps.visual_description: A pink paper triangle with a peacock feather pattern. The bottom two corners are folded upwards to meet at the center line.

steps.instruction: Fold the points back so they line up with the outside edges.
steps.visual_description: The folded paper from step 2, with the two pointed flaps folded outwards so their edges align with the outer edges of the shape.

steps.instruction: Poke a finger inside each flap to pop them out, then flatten along the seam to create two kite shapes.
steps.visual_description: The paper shape from step 3, where the two flaps have been opened up and flattened to form kite-like shapes.

projects.finished_product_description: A collection of colorful origami flowers, some with five petals and some with more, arranged at the bottom of the page.

diagram_descriptions: A page titled 'FLOWERS' with four numbered steps illustrating how to fold an origami flower. The steps show a pink paper with a peacock feather pattern being folded.
A decorative border of origami flowers in various colors (red, yellow, blue) at the bottom of the page.

projects.name: Kusudama Flower Petal

steps.instruction: Fold the top triangle of the kite shapes flat so they are level with the long edge behind.
steps.visual_description: A pink and gold patterned paper shape folded into kite shapes. The top triangle of each kite shape is being folded flat, aligning with the long edge behind.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides in to create a square shape.
steps.visual_description: The paper shape from step 5 is further folded. The sides are brought inwards to form a square-like shape with four points sticking up.

steps.instruction: Bring the two sides together to create a petal. Glue in place.
steps.visual_description: Hands are holding the folded paper shape. Two sides are being brought together and creased to form a petal shape. A dotted line indicates where to glue.

steps.instruction: Repeat until you have five petals, then glue them together along the join one at a time.
steps.visual_description: A partially assembled kusudama flower with four petals already joined. A fifth petal is being held and aligned to be glued to the existing structure.

projects.finished_product_description: A decorative kusudama flower made of folded paper petals.

diagram_descriptions: A decorative kusudama flower made of folded paper petals, shown in various colors (blue, orange, yellow, pink) at the bottom of the page.

projects.name: Crepe Paper Flower

steps.instruction: Cut three leaves from green crepe paper and snip the edges to create a serrated effect.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding scissors cutting the edge of a green crepe paper leaf to create a serrated effect.

steps.instruction: Wrap the base of the leaves around the end of a length of floral wire and glue in place.
steps.visual_description: A hand holding three green crepe paper leaves and wrapping their bases around the end of a green floral wire.

steps.instruction: Position the leaves at the base of the flower’s head. Hold both wires together, and wrap them with a long strip of green crepe paper.
steps.visual_description: A hand positioning green crepe paper leaves at the base of a white flower head, holding wires together, and wrapping them with a long strip of green crepe paper.

steps.instruction: Cut the stem about 4cm (1½in) from the flower head using pliers.
steps.visual_description: A hand using red-handled pliers to cut a green stem about 4cm (1½in) below a white flower head.

projects.finished_product_description: A handmade crepe paper flower with green leaves and a stem.

projects.name: Buttonhole

steps.instruction: Wrap green paper around the end of the stem to neaten.
steps.visual_description: A white paper flower with green leaves and stem. A strip of green paper is being wrapped around the end of the stem.

steps.instruction: Tie a length of ribbon around the top of the stem.
steps.visual_description: A white paper flower with green leaves and stem. A pink ribbon is tied around the top of the stem, just below the flower head.

steps.instruction: Wrap the ribbon around the stem from top to bottom, then wrap it back up to the top.
steps.visual_description: Hands are wrapping a pink ribbon around the stem of a white paper flower. The ribbon is being wrapped from the top of the stem downwards and then back up.

steps.instruction: Tie off again at the base of the flower head and cut away excess ribbon.
steps.visual_description: Hands are tying a pink ribbon in a knot at the base of the flower head of a white paper flower. Excess ribbon is visible.
